mnemonic: MEU sounds like 'MAY you' - MAY YOU see MY stuff!
grammar_notes: Masculine singular. Agrees with noun not owner. 'Meus' is plural.
cultural_note: 'Meu Deus!' (My God!) is a common exclamation in Portugal.

grammar_notes: Feminine singular. The 'nh' sounds like Spanish 'ñ'. 'Minhas' is plural.
cultural_note: 'Minha Nossa Senhora!' is a religious exclamation still used today.
tip: Used with feminine nouns - 'nh' like Spanish ñ

mnemonic: TEU = TAY-oo - TAY who? YOUR informal friend!
grammar_notes: Informal 'your' (tu form). Masculine singular. 'Teus' is plural.
cultural_note: Northern Portugal uses 'teu' much more than Lisbon!
'A tua mãe' in jokes - same as English 'your mom' jokes exist!

grammar_notes: Formal 'your' OR 'his/her'. Context clarifies. Use dele/dela for clarity.
cultural_note: In Brazil 'seu' is very common. In Portugal use 'o/a senhor/a' for extra formality.
tip: Formal or his/her - context determines meaning

cultural_note: 'A sua saúde!' (To your health!) - common Portuguese toast!

mnemonic: NOSSO = NO-SO - it's NOT SO yours it's OURS!
grammar_notes: First person plural masculine. 'Nossos' for plural nouns.
cultural_note: 'O nosso Benfica' - Portuguese are passionate about their football clubs!

grammar_notes: First person plural feminine. 'Nossas' for plural.
cultural_note: 'Nossa Senhora!' is a common exclamation - literally 'Our Lady'.

mnemonic: DELE = DE + ELE = of him = HIS!
grammar_notes: Clarifies 'seu' ambiguity. Literally 'of him'. Goes AFTER noun.
cultural_note: In European Portuguese 'dele' is clearer than 'seu' for 'his'.

mnemonic: DELA = DE + ELA = of her = HERS!
grammar_notes: Clarifies 'sua' ambiguity. Literally 'of her'. Goes AFTER noun.
cultural_note: 'O marido dela' (her husband) - used when 'seu' would be confusing.

mnemonic: DELES = DE + ELES = of them (masc) = THEIR!
grammar_notes: Masculine plural or mixed group. Goes after noun.
cultural_note: 'Os amigos deles' - Portuguese culture values friendship groups highly.

mnemonic: DELAS = DE + ELAS = of them (fem) = THEIR (ladies)!
grammar_notes: Feminine plural - only for all-female groups.
cultural_note: 'As amigas delas' - female friend groups are tight-knit in Portugal!
